p: In the last ten years, there has been an increasing incidence of disseminated filamentous fungal infections in patients with severe immunosuppression [ 1, 2, 4]. Hematological malignancies have a risk of 6.5% for IFI [ 5], mainly in the induction and consolidation phases. This increase is due to severe immunosuppression conditions by myelotoxic treatments and related clinical conditions but also to new technologies such as molecular biology [ 6, 7] that have increased the diagnosis ability.
